verses.plain: O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:

tokens.t: O
my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:

verses.plain: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.

tokens.t: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending
in pieces, while
none to deliver.

verses.plain: O LORD my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;

tokens.t: O
my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;

verses.plain: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

tokens.t: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

verses.plain: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.

tokens.t: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take
yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.

verses.plain: Arise, O LORD, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.

tokens.t: Arise, O
, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me
the judgment
thou hast commanded.

verses.plain: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.

tokens.t: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.

verses.plain: The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.

tokens.t: The
shall judge the people: judge me, O
, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity
in me.

verses.plain: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.

tokens.t: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.

verses.plain: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.

tokens.t: My defence
of God, which saveth the upright in heart.

verses.plain: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.

tokens.t: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry
every day.

verses.plain: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

tokens.t: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

verses.plain: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

tokens.t: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

verses.plain: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

tokens.t: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

verses.plain: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.

tokens.t: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch
he made.

verses.plain: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.

tokens.t: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.

verses.plain: I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.

tokens.t: I will praise the
according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the
most high.

footnotes.text: My…: Heb. My buckler is upon God
judgeth…: or, is a righteous judge
He made a pit: Heb. He hath digged a pit
